title: February Jobs Report: Biggest Gains Were In Restaurants And Bars
teaser: Economist Diane Swonk breaks down the latest report, which shows the economy added 295,000 jobs and the jobless rate fell to 5.5 percent.
contentencoded:
Today the Labor Department announced that the U.S. economy added 295,000 jobs in February, and the national unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent.

The report showed the biggest gains in employment were at restaurants and bars. There was also growth in the construction industry, despite February’s record-breaking cold temperatures.

Diane Swonk, chief economist with Mesirow Financial, breaks down the jobs report with Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson.

  • Read Diane Swonk’s report on the latest jobs report

Guest

  • Diane Swonk, chief economist with Mesirow Financial. She tweets @DianeSwonk.
